description_txt: stated on September 23, 2009 in a speech to investors in Hong Kong:
quote_txt: "The Defense Department received only one-half of 1 percent of the nearly trillion-dollar stimulus package funding."

description_txt: stated on September 28, 2009 in a chain e-mail:
quote_txt: "For the first time in history, the Democratic Congress will not allow an increase in the social security COLA (cost of living adjustment)."

description_txt: stated on September 28, 2009 in a Web ad:
quote_txt: Barack Obama and the Democrats have "proposed a tax for not having health insurance."

description_txt: stated on September 28, 2009 in a news release:
quote_txt: "House Republicans pledged to introduce a bill to reform America’s health care system," but "the 'party of no' has . . . failed to produce legislation."

description_txt: stated on September 25, 2009 in a blast e-mail from Republican National Committee:
quote_txt: In a now-viral video, "impressionable youngsters at a public school in New Jersey ... have been instructed to sing the praises of 'Barack Hussein Obama.'"

description_txt: stated on September 23, 2009 in an interview on "The Colbert Report":
quote_txt: Goldman Sachs was Barack Obama's "No. 1 private contributor."

description_txt: stated on September 22, 2009 in an interview with Sen. John McCain on Fox News Channel:
quote_txt: The Obama administration is "cutting back on defense"

description_txt: stated on September 22, 2009 in votes in 2004 and 2009:
quote_txt: On whether the governor of Massachusetts should be able to appoint an interim U.S. senator

description_txt: stated on June 24, 2009 in a letter to the Minnesota delegation in Washington:
quote_txt: On a cap-and-trade plan.

description_txt: stated on September 20, 2009 in an interview on "This Week with George Stephanopolous.":
quote_txt: "Medicare does just as good, if not better, at keeping people healthy" as Medicare Advantage.

description_txt: stated on September 22, 2009 in his Fox News program:
quote_txt: "Our own National Security Agency says that (Iran's) nuclear ambitions are advancing, and at the same time ... we are slashing our own nuclear arsenal."

description_txt: stated on September 21, 2009 in interview on "Late Night with David Letterman":
quote_txt: "FDR was called a socialist and a communist."

description_txt: stated on September 16, 2009 in a speech on the House floor:
quote_txt: "Recent census data shows that the average American family spends over $13,000 a year for health care coverage."

description_txt: stated on September 17, 2009 in a White House announcement:
quote_txt: On whether he would put a missile shield in Poland.

description_txt: stated on September 16, 2009 in a press release:
quote_txt: "Under the Baucus bill ... federal funds would subsidize coverage of elective abortions."

description_txt: stated on September 16, 2009 in a press release:
quote_txt: The Baucus bill "contains provisions that would send massive federal subsidies directly to both private insurance plans and government-chartered cooperatives that pay for elective abortion."

description_txt: stated on September 18, 2009 in a speech:
quote_txt: "In some states, it is still legal to deny a woman coverage because she's been the victim of domestic violence."

description_txt: stated on September 20, 2009 in an interview on This Week with George Stephanopoulos:
quote_txt: Families are paying $900, on average, "in higher premiums because of uncompensated care."

description_txt: stated on September 20, 2009 in an interview on Meet the Press:
quote_txt: "Mathematically, the White Sox can still get in the playoffs."

description_txt: stated on September 16, 2009 in a press release:
quote_txt: The Obama administration's cap-and-trade plan would create "a $1,761 yearly energy tax."

description_txt: stated on September 15, 2009 in a television advertisement:
quote_txt: Health insurance companies deny "1 out of 5 treatments prescribed by doctors."

description_txt: stated on September 9, 2009 in a speech to a joint session of Congress:
quote_txt: Insurers delayed an Illinois man's treatment, "and he died because of it."

description_txt: stated on September 16, 2009 in his television show "Countdown":
quote_txt: For middle-class families under the Baucus plan, "13 percent of what they make could be deducted directly from their paychecks . . . the so-called 'Max Tax.'"

description_txt: stated on September 16, 2009 in an interview on Fox News:
quote_txt: Obama used to be a lawyer for ACORN.

description_txt: stated on September 15, 2009 in a television advertisement:
quote_txt: Health insurance companies pay CEOs $24 million a year

description_txt: stated on September 14, 2009 in a fundraising letter:
quote_txt: "Medicare began as a public option and now holds 97 percent of the market share."

description_txt: stated on September 15, 2009 in a floor speech:
quote_txt: The House of Representatives has never passed a resolution of disapproval to condemn a member's behavior.

description_txt: stated on September 13, 2009 in remarks on NBC's Meet the Press:
quote_txt: "Every other democracy in the world has a health care system that covers everybody, and we don't."

description_txt: stated on September 8, 2009 in a column in Investor's Business Daily.:
quote_txt: The Obama administration "was successful in rushing a massive spending bill through Congress in just two days — after which it sat on the president's desk for three days, while he was away on vacation."

description_txt: stated on September 9, 2009 in a YouTube video:
quote_txt: The U.S. ranks 37th in the world for health care.
